com.kuka.io

Class IoUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.kuka.io.IoUtil

  • public final class IoUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods for IO Support.
    This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods

      Gets the minimum value for the supplied IO size.

      Joins the specified IO group name and IO name to an IO ID.

      Splits the specified IO ID into the two parts IO group name and IO name.

      Checks whether the specified value is valid for a digital output with the specified type and bit size.

    • Method Detail

      • splitIoId

        public static String[] splitIoId(String ioId)
        Splits the specified IO ID into the two parts IO group name and IO name.
        Parameters:
        ioId - the full IO ID which is formatted like IOGroupName.IOName
        Returns:
        an array which contains the IO group name at index 0 and the IO name at index 1.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the IO ID is null
        • if the IO ID to split contains more than one

      • joinIoId

        public static String joinIoId(String ioGroupName,
                              String ioName)
        Joins the specified IO group name and IO name to an IO ID.
        Parameters:
        ioGroupName - the IO group name
        ioName - the IO name
        Returns:
        the IO ID which is formatted like IOGroupName.IOName

      • getDigitalMinValue

        public static long getDigitalMinValue(boolean signed,
                                      int ioSize)
        Gets the maximum value for the supplied IO size.
        Parameters:
        signed - IO is signed
        ioSize - size of the IO
        Returns:
        the maximum value
        This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

      • getDigitalMaxValue

        public static long getDigitalMaxValue(boolean signed,
                                      int ioSize)
        Gets the minimum value for the supplied IO size.
        Parameters:
        signed - IO is signed
        ioSize - size of the IO
        Returns:
        the minimum value
        This element is an undocumented internal feature. It is not intended to be used by applications as it might change or be removed in future versions.

      • validateValue

        public static void validateValue(Number value,
                                 IIoDefinition ioDefinition)
        Checks whether the specified value is valid for the IO with the specified IO definition.

        An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the value is not valid.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        ioDefinition - the definition of the IO
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is not valid

      • validateAnalogOutput

        public static void validateAnalogOutput(Number value,
                                        double rangeStart,
                                        double rangeEnd)
        Checks whether the specified value is valid for an analog output with the specified range.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        rangeStart - the start range of the analog output
        rangeEnd - the end range of the analog output

      • validateDigitalOutput

        public static void validateDigitalOutput(Number value,
                                         com.kuka.roboticsAPI.ioModel.IOTypes type,
                                         int size)
        Checks whether the specified value is valid for a digital output with the specified type and bit size.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        type - the type of the digital output
        size - the bit size of the digital output
